intro: Miconia albiviridis, commonly known as the white-veined miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with prominent white veins, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Miconia albiviridis is often found in humid, lowland rainforests and is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets.
